review: I have a Chromecast, the Roku Stick and the Amazon Fire TV Stick. I can without a doubt say that the Fire TV Stick is the best for me. The Chromecast doesn't do much more than allow you to beam content from your device to your TV (which the Fire Stick and Roku Stick also do). The Roku is very similar in it's offering to the Fire TV Stick, but for those with Prime and/or those with a lot of content from Amazon, this device is a must! It turns any TV into a smart TV. I didn't plan on using the gaming options myself, but my kids think it's really cool that they can hop on the TV and play Flappy Birds or Tetris with the remote. Best buy I have made in a long time.

review: I was so excited about the Fire Stick since it offers all the options that I want but does not work with my main television. The first one I received synced up to my main TV  just fine and I was even able to start streaming but the power started cutting out with short bursts of sound through the speakers. I returned it for a replacement. The new one won't hook up to my main TV at all now offering an error about the power adapter even though it was hooked up to the provided power. However, it works just fine  with my smaller TV. It's interesting because my Chromecast works just fine on any TV I've tried. Obviously the Chromecast doesn't work with Amazon Prime Videos so that is another issue in and of itself. In any case the Fire stick is not very useful on a TV that I don't watch very much, considering giving it to my mother and getting a roku so that I can actually use my Amazon Prime Videos on a screen bigger than a note card.
